intro: Cathartocarpus brasilianus, commonly known as the Brazilian broom, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers that appear in clusters. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. It is often found in open woodland and grassland habitats, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
